Creates a lookup table for individual prediction of risk based on PHS

create_lookup_table.Rd

This function takes a data set of phs, age, and status and returns two matrices: one is the PHS score at each of 99 percentiles (1-99\ is predicted K-M curve (plus confidence intervals) for each of these percentiles. These two tables contain now individualized subject information and can be exported to predict risk for new subjects for which you have PHS scores.

Usage

create_lookup_table(data = NULL, phs = "phs", age = "age", status = "status")

Arguments

data

an optional data.frame containing the variables for phs, age, and status

phs

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing the polygenic hazard score for each subject or the unquoted name of a vector containing these values. The default is "phs"

age

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing the age of each subject or the unquoted name of a vector containing these values. For cases, this should be the age at event (e.g., diagnosis) and for controls this should be age of censoring (e.g., last observation). The default is "age"

status

an optional string specifying the column name in data containing case-control status (0 = censored, 1 = event) or the unquoted name of a vector containing these values. The default is "status"

Value

A list containing two tables

Examples


lookup_table <- create_lookup_table(test_data)
